meanings.definition: Not able to be saved or repaired.
meanings.sent1: The old, rusty car was unsalvageable and could not be fixed.
meanings.sent2: The shipwreck was unsalvageable, lost forever at the bottom of the sea.
meanings.sent3: The unsalvageable cake was a sad sight, burnt to a crisp and inedible.
meanings.sent4: After the hurricane, the town was left unsalvageable, with buildings destroyed beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The unsalvageable toy was broken into pieces, beyond any hope of being put back together.

meanings.sent1: The unsalvageable situation left them feeling hopeless and lost.
meanings.sent2: The unsalvageable relationship had reached a point of no return.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the unsalvageable mess only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The unsalvageable bridge collapsed under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent5: The unsalvageable plan fell apart, leaving them stranded and confused.
